input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Ability to swim has a direct effect on studying habit and exam score. Studying habit has a direct effect on exam score. The overall probability of being able to swim is 8%. The probability of not being able to swim and high exam score is 36%. The probability of being able to swim and high exam score is 7%. Is the chance of high exam score larger when observing being able to swim?
